name: elephant_rock
description: Welcome to Elephant Rock! Located in AlUla, this stunning natural formation resembles an elephant with its trunk touching the ground. It dates back millions of years and is one of Saudi Arabia’s most iconic landmarks. Visitors can enjoy the breathtaking desert scenery and relax at nearby cafés.

name: maraya
description: Welcome to Maraya! Situated in AlUla, this mirrored concert hall is the largest of its kind in the world. Opened in 2019, it reflects the surrounding desert landscapes, symbolizing harmony between nature and modern architecture. It hosts concerts, art exhibitions, and cultural events.

name: ithraa
description: Welcome to Ithra! Also known as the King Abdulaziz Center for World Culture, it is located in Al-Khobar. Opened in 2018, it is a center for collaborative creativity, housing thousands of books across diverse fields and encouraging reading. Visitors can explore various exhibitions and cultural experiences.

name: king_fahad_fountain
description: Welcome to King Fahad Fountain! Located in Jeddah, it is the tallest fountain in the world, reaching over 300 meters. Built in the 1980s, it represents Jeddah’s spirit and beauty along the Red Sea. Best viewed at night with its stunning illuminated jets.

name: almasmak
description: Welcome to Al Masmak Fort! A historic fortress located in the heart of Riyadh. Built in the late 19th century, it played an important role in the unification of Saudi Arabia. Visitors can explore its museum and learn about the Kingdom’s heritage.
